sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Popery and hypocrisy detected and opened from the Holy Scriptures as it respects magistrates, ministers, and people. In a sermon upon the occasion of a general fast, kept Decemb. 22. 1680. By the author of the Plotters doom, a true son of the Church of England. Palmer, Samuel, d. 1724.
[2], 36 p.
printed for Richard Janeway, in Queens-Head-Alley in Pater-Noster Row, London : 1680.
Author of the Plotters doom, a true son of the Church of England = Samuel Palmer. Caption title on p.1 reads: A fast-sermon upon Joel II. 13. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
Popery and hypocrisy detected and opened from the Holy Scriptures as it respects magistrates, ministers, and people. In a sermon upon the occasion of a general fast, kept Decemb. 22. 1680. By the author of the Plotters doom, a true son of the Church of England. Palmer, Samuel, d. 1724.
[2], 36 p.
printed for Richard Janeway, in Queens-Head-Alley in Pater-Noster Row, London : 1680.
Author of the Plotters doom, a true son of the Church of England = Samuel Palmer. Caption title on p.1 reads: A fast-sermon upon Joel II. 13. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Richard Janeway
Queens-Head-Alley in Pater-Noster Row
